question.title: Cookies in localhost
question.body:
I am having difficulties with the following scenario.

I have an API that generates tokens and responds with an HTTPOnly cookie. This API is in a development environment (Cloud Server) at the URL https://example.com/api.

I am developing a React application locally that needs to call this API to generate the token. So far, everything is working.

The cookie is set as HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite=None and I see in my API's response that the Set-Cookie comes with the domain set to example.com (here's the problem).

Therefore, when my React application, which is running on localhost, tries to make a request to another API that is also on localhost, the cookie does not reach it.

The scenario I expect is:

  • My React application generates the token in the API running on the server at the URL https://example.com/api.
  • The server responds, and the cookies are set.
  • My React application makes a request to another API that is running locally, and the cookies are sent to it.

When everything is running locally, it works, but I do not want to have to run all the applications locally for it to succeed; I want to run only those that are in development.

Is there any way to handle cookies when executing applications on localhost?

question_comments.body: Cookies are tied to domains. You cannot use cookies for example.org for localhost or vice versa.
May be you should use authorization token in header instead of a cookie. The token you can add yourself just as needed in requests to whatever server you want to use.
